titleInfo.title: There’s something about a soldier, from the Nashville Times, 1940

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), showing the patriotic group as “the small but most colorful part of Hume-Fogg’s R. O. T. C., as it lined up with lifted chins and straightened shoulders on the steps of the school on Broad Street. Beauty as well as the purely military plays a prominent part in the corp’s general set-up, as evidenced by presence in the above picture of the sponsors, Ann Morrison, extreme left, Battalion sponsor; Doris Grubbs, left, regimental sponsor; Betsey Harrison, center, Company A sponsor, and Jennie Lee Jackson, extreme right, Company B. sponsor. The others, left to right, are Charles Vaughn, color bearer; Battalion Commander Maj. Gay Weber, Staff Sergeant John Greene, Company A. Captain Dick McLaughlin, Company B. Captain Luther George, and Color Bearer Jack Martin.” Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission. Please contact the Metro Archives, Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219. Telephone (615) 862-5880.
